lenders.name: Chelsea
lenders.loan_because: it's a good way to connect with people from all over the world and learn about them. I want people to have the same opportunities that I have.

lenders.name: Andrea
lenders.occupational_info: I sleep away from home every night in a small room with another person called a dorm.  I wake up and walk across my school into a building with rooms for classes. I attend classes anywhere from 2-7 times daily.  I do the assignments from the class when I'm not in class.  I generally hang out with people in the afternoon. Go to bed at a late hour and then wake up and repeat the process.

lenders.name: San Dieguito Academy

lenders.name: Tyler

lenders.occupational_info: I teach English to Japanese university students.

lenders.name: Dana
lenders.occupational_info: I work in a small shop. In September I will return to university to become a school teacher.

lenders.name: Geri
lenders.loan_because: For Christmas 2007, my 17-year-old step-son gave me the book "Banker to the Poor" by 2006 Nobel Peace Prize Winner, Muhammad Yunus, founder of the Grameen Bank.  I was fascinated and inspired by the book  and the concept of micro-credit lending - the idea of helping primarily very poor women, their families and communities by funding their entrepreneurial endeavors seems to make so much sense. I've been a Kiva lender and donor ever since.
lenders.occupational_info: Uber fulfilling!

lenders.name: Bill
lenders.loan_because: I want people to be successful, and everyone should have access to good tools.
lenders.occupational_info: I help build virtual worlds.

lenders.occupational_info: An MBA Student

lenders.occupational_info: I fix airplanes that move people and cargo around the world.

lenders.name: Adam

lenders.occupational_info: I do several different jobs around a news station. Operating a camera and running teleprompter, cueing video, and operating the graphics system are some of my responsibilities.

"Seva Paramo Dharma/"  (Sanskrit)
To serve is the most important duty.
lenders.occupational_info: Serve the place which has given you everything, a house to live, school to study, food to eat, friends to be and memories to cherish.

lenders.name: jean
lenders.loan_because: I wanted to set-up an outlet to support the scholarship of the  Daraghuyan Tribe youth (indegenous people)  based in Bukidnon, Philippines http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0Hur0I1hh1I.  I will give them free franchise but we need to raise funds to set-up their outlets. The profit that they will make from the operation will sustain part of the schooling expenses of the youth. Please visit our website   www.soupoftheday.weebly.com and see the blog section about the fund raising activity for the lumads.
lenders.occupational_info: I am an entrepreneur who wanted to do business to sustain my goal to help others through job creation and creating business opportunities. lenders.name: abbie

lenders.name: Bryce
lenders.loan_because: To extend opportunity to those that otherwise may not have access to it.

lenders.name: Kelly

lenders.loan_because:
I want to make lives better one purse at a time. :)

I believe that a better world is possible and I want to begin by doing my part to alleviate poverty.


"So whatever you wish that others would do to you do also to them for this is the law and the prophets."
- Jesus
lenders.occupational_info: I make customizable bags from my home and give 10% of every transaction to an entrepreneur on the other side of the world.  Every customer receives a picture of the person their bag went to help

lenders.name: Becca
lenders.loan_because: no one should feel forgotten.

lenders.loan_because: because this simply act can make someone's life a little bit easier.

lenders.name: Nikos & Linda
lenders.loan_because: we believe in positive change and we love how technology enables us to connect directly to a human being somewhere on this Earth that we can help.
lenders.occupational_info:
As restauranteurs, we serve lovely Greek food in an atmosphere of beauty, and hope to be a catalyst for living well. As writers and filmmakers, we explore what connects us all through books, stories and films.
As an educator, we work with schools to promote curriculum that matters, especially that which connects students to life around the world.

lenders.name: Rebecca
lenders.loan_because: I can, and want to share what I have.  And hopefully those whom I help, through their efforts, will help others.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm just getting my own consulting business off the ground, sharing my experience and knowledge with companies and organizations who need corporate communication support and services.  From developing strategic communication plans to executing media relations campaigns ... from providing onsite communication and PR support to writing press releases and collateral ... I do what I can to make my clients look good and to make sure they can tell their stories in the best ways possible.

lenders.name: Joyce
lenders.loan_because: In a very small way, I hope I can make a difference to someone else's life.

lenders.name: Mike & Amy
lenders.loan_because: We've been blessed with many great opportunities and a wonderful family, hopefully we can share some of  our blessings with other people.

lenders.name: Suzanna & Richard
lenders.loan_because: Microloaning allows us to get involved on a more personal and direct level. We admire people's entrepreneurial spirit the world over, and want to support that to the best of our ability.
lenders.occupational_info: Suzanna works as a freelance graphic designer and travel photographer. Richard is an industrial electrician.

lenders.name: Amanda
lenders.loan_because: I think this is an AMAZING cause! I really like the idea that women in impoverished communities across the world can change their lot in life with just my $25 loan. I think this is a fantastic way to make a difference in the world. :)
lenders.occupational_info: I work at a retail store while going to school. I am starting my master's degree in the fall. I've already gone to college and recieved a bachelor's degree in Anthropology, the study of people and their cultures. I think that I would like to work for a non-profit organization that makes a difference in the world.

lenders.name: Rick and Carly Hansen
lenders.loan_because: It feels good.

lenders.name: Nancy
lenders.loan_because: I believe that everyone who is able needs to help out those less fortunate in the world. It is very fulfilling to aid others make their lives better.
lenders.occupational_info: The bus service is for people with physical disabilities and the elderly that cannot use conventional transit, so we provide a door to door service.

lenders.name: Robert & Victoria
lenders.loan_because: We want to make a difference in someone elses lives!
lenders.occupational_info: We take steel, metal, and with the help of machines make it in to something someone can use or wants.

lenders.name: Kate
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people build sustainable businesses that change their lives
lenders.occupational_info: real estate- I sell homes

lenders.name: Theo
lenders.loan_because:
My work involves helping businesses here in Australia raise money through equity funding; selling part of their business in exchange for funds. Typically customers feel they need hundreds of thousands of dollars to start a business and to make a difference in their lives. 

I love the fact that through Kiva, such small amounts of money can really make a difference to a whole family and community ... so I'm in!
lenders.occupational_info: I help people raise money they need for their business by selling part of their business.

lenders.name: Brendan
lenders.loan_because: I care about the world!

lenders.name: Dan
lenders.loan_because: I am fortunate enough to do so - I consider it an honor to help others become more independent and self-sustaining. I believe that the place to invest our money when trying to help poverty is into the hands of people who are committed to working hard to help themselves, not just waiting for a handout.

lenders.loan_because: I am a small biz owner and that is where my heart is, with the little guy all over the world.

lenders.name: Cheryl

lenders.name: Bonnie&Emily

lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because: I think we should help those who are less fortunate than ourselves

lenders.name: Ian
lenders.loan_because: I can

lenders.name: Danica
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people become self sufficient and elevate them out of poverty. We take so much for granted. I want  to help someone else who wants to help themselves, but is having difficulty accessing the resources to do it.
lenders.occupational_info: Doctor in emergency medicine

lenders.name: Lauren
lenders.loan_because: Trying to reset the balance of opportunity for others who have every reason to be successful in their lives. This is especially true for women and girls who remain the single most endangered "species" on earth.
lenders.occupational_info: I have dedicated my life to helping other folks. I work for NGO type organizations within my community locally, nationally and internationally. We are very successful in many ways. Yet, I want to help my neighbor directly, whether it is across the world or not. I am a single women, have never been married. I take my life's joy in making significant relationships with other people. Thank you for making this very personal and simple.

lenders.name: TEEN
lenders.loan_because: StumbledUpon'd Kiva. The very next day I read Deuternomy 15 in the Bible which talks about lending to the needy. Jesus promotes even making loans when there isn't much chance of getting your money back. I think God smiles when He thinks of what's going on via Kiva.

lenders.loan_because: This is not the driod you are looking for...
lenders.occupational_info: Beeping alllllllllll the way

lenders.name: kairi

lenders.name: Nolio
lenders.loan_because: I'd like to contribute to a more balanced globe.

lenders.name: Valerie Corey
lenders.loan_because: I am so appreciative of my many blessings and I truly believe we can make the biggest difference by empowering others to help themselves... it's a win/win.  Kiva has made this possible in the simplest, most wonderful way.  They are angels.
lenders.occupational_info: One by one, I work with people via vibrational healing methods (Reiki, EFT, Flower Essences) who wish to connect with their wholeness, oneness and wellness... the WOW within so they may truly recognize their uniqueness.  I am a bridge to the light. within.

lenders.loan_because: I want to help people who want to work for a better life

lenders.name: Chris
lenders.loan_because: sometimes my idealism overwhelms my cynicism.

lenders.name: stacy
lenders.loan_because: The people on kiva are inspiring.

lenders.name: Barbara
lenders.loan_because: I like to see everyone have a home and food and a quality life. I am blessed to have all this.
lenders.occupational_info: I am now retired-no longer working at a day to day job, but worked as a nurse helping deliver babies and then as a psychologist--someone who helps people to improve their lives by dealing with the problems in their lives.

lenders.name: Viva
lenders.loan_because: I want to make a positive difference in the world!

lenders.name: Sheri
lenders.occupational_info: I work in a library, loaning people books, and have a small sewing business I run out of my home.

lenders.name: Abbriell
lenders.loan_because: I admire people who work hard to make life better for themselves and their families.

lenders.loan_because: It is one of the many ways I can help others in far away homes. It is a convenient way for me to be of assist to those who are working as hard as I am at making a living for them and their families. Together we can!
lenders.occupational_info: I am a guide for those who seek a spiritual path in order to improve their lives, recovery from addictions, and trauma. lenders.loan_because: I know what it is  to be without and have no one to turn to This is a way of giving back a little  for being so very bless....
